intro: Ornithopus ebracteatus, commonly known as the slender pinnate grassvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and pinnately divided leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in spikes, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Ornithopus ebracteatus typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It is often found in arid or semi-arid regions and is adapted to thrive in low-nutrient environments.
